name: charcuterie
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
[ U ] cold cooked or preserved meat: You might serve a plate of charcuterie to start.
[ C ] a shop that sells cold cooked or preserved meat: We used to have a charcuterie and a butcher in the village.
More examplesFewer examplesCharcuterie and Dijon mustard are inseparable.For the picnic, she brought cheese, charcuterie, and blueberry tart.Grilled or roasted vegetables are delicious served cold with some lean charcuterie. I felt no need to cook when the boulangerie and charcuterie were five minutes distant.He had been to every charcuterie in town looking for the type of garlic sausage he wanted.The converted butcher's is now a champagne-oyster bar, sandwich shop and charcuterie.
